Text:
Our communities thrive when we put our kids first. 

For the wellbeing of our kids, we need to make affordable child care available for everyone. That starts with #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/BF2kwcIn7n

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act includes new funding for @BrandUSA to show the world why we love the Green Mountain State. That's great for Vermont's businesses, state parks, and cultural institutions.

Let's get this bill signed into law so we can welcome visitors back to Vermont.

Renewable energy builds a more resilient electric grid, lowers greenhouse gas emissions, and creates new jobs. That's good for families and the planet. 

We need to pass #BuildBackBetter and #AmericaCOMPETES to build an American-made clean energy future. 
https://t.co/xABVvyeT81
I’ll keep fighting to #ReplenishRRF. Businesses in Vermont and across the country need this lifeline. https://t.co/S9atsFMkjD

The Senate needs to move forward on #BuildBackBetter and get folks the help they need. Childcare, prescription drugs – these things aren't luxuries. We’ve got to get this done for Vermonters. https://t.co/bL57Z6apo6

Restaurants need our help. The pandemic has put a brutal strain on these businesses, but we can help them thrive again with a bit more help. 

I urge @POTUS  to back additional support for struggling restaurants as we continue to recover from this pandemic.

The #ChildTaxCredit helps kids, parents, and communities thrive. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to pass the expanded CTC that the House sent over to build a better future for our kids. https://t.co/Lerkrw5Kao

I’ve joined @RepCori, @SenBooker, and many others to ask the Biden Administration to examine the disparate treatment of Black migrants and reverse policies that deny asylum seekers the opportunity to pursue their claims. 

We must break this cycle of injustice. https://t.co/7wXMPRg9T6

Extreme weather gets more common as climate change worsens. In Vermont, we've seen more drought, with the longest lasting 71 weeks. That's dire for VT farmers. 

We must pass #BuildBackBetter to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and combat climate change. https://t.co/aQkuSgSJSb

Last year was the second biggest year for US clean energy on record -- that's good news, but we have a lot more to do to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and address the climate crisis.

We have to pass #BuildBackBetter and build our clean energy future. 
https://t.co/EG7ZPiMt1n

20% of Vermonters lack broadband access, and 70% can't access the highest speed service, making it harder for Vermonters to thrive in our digital world. 

Today I'm talking with @NTIAgov on how we can bridge the #DigitalDivide for Vermonters. Tune in here: https://t.co/kqR5nbZvoF

Today marks the 3rd anniversary of Jenna Tatro's passing. 

We mourn her passing, remember her life, and celebrate the work her family continues to do for Vermonters struggling with substance abuse. 
https://t.co/lTc5cIbTKN
Another medal comes home to the Green Mountains. Congratulations, Megan! https://t.co/vZro9kWMSF

Today marks four years since the tragic shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School. We remember the victims and honor them by keeping up the fight for common sense gun control. 

Stoneman Douglas students ignited a movement -- it's up to us to take action now.
Investments in fair and affordable housing are long overdue. To combat homelessness and ensure stable housing for all, we need to #ShowHousingLove and #PassBuildBackBetter.

Updates to our appliance energy efficiency standards are badly needed. 

Let’s bring our standards up to date, so we can protect our planet and save Americans money. https://t.co/BatJpzZ4MG

Jason's work is beautiful and moving. Wonderful to see one of Vermont's many talented artists getting some well-deserved recognition on the national stage. Congratulations, Jason!

https://t.co/QWUQOlmKHI

Applications for the Congressional Art Competition are now available on my website.  All young artists in Vermont are encouraged to apply, and the winner will have their artwork displayed in the Capitol for one year. For more, visit: https://t.co/6KlG66rBYA https://t.co/9XuvR0J78l

Bill's a true Vermont legend. His love for his sport and passion for our environment is an inspiration to us all. 
https://t.co/r0hwlR1Jye

Congratulations, Ryan! Medaling at the Olympics is an incredible accomplishment, made even more special by your mom's medal 50 years prior. Glad to have you representing Vermonters on the podium!

https://t.co/kR5DjFaUnx

Unions give their members the support they need to thrive, helping secure better conditions, stronger benefits, and fair compensation for every American worker. 

We need to help unions grow and remain strong so that all who choose to join can do so. 
https://t.co/C08pvio1wA

Last night, the House passed the bipartisan Postal Service Reform Act, a historic step to protect postal service for all Americans. 

This bill will improve the service for USPS - getting mail out quicker and more reliably to all Vermonters. 

https://t.co/F4SbPlaosi

The postal service is a mess, and it's failing rural Americans. Reform is long overdue. 

I'm pleased to support the Postal Service Reform Act when the House votes on it today, so Vermonters can get the postal service they need and deserve. https://t.co/YErhpXhPFR

The Trump administration rolled back essential environmental protections that kept our communities safe from pollution. 

I'm glad that @EPA is working to reinstate strong limits on mercury emissions to protect our families and environment. 
https://t.co/huf7F5dQLx

Many Americans have lost their right to tell their stories of sexual abuse and harassment by signing forced arbitration clauses hidden in everyday contracts. It has to stop. 

That's why I'm voting to #EndForcedArbitration now for survivors of sexual assault and harassment.
Congratulations, Deedra! You make Vermonters so proud. https://t.co/kG0emad9jr

Good news from USDA! From @PetesGreens to @KCofVT, these grant recipients will help develop Vermont's economy and keep jobs and opportunities in the Green Mountain State. Congratulations to all!

https://t.co/lj0MhjBIR2

Everyone deserves bargaining rights and a voice in the workplace. 

As a long-time supporter of unions and a co-sponsor of the PRO Act, I fully support congressional staffers unionizing if they choose. https://t.co/oqLBDyWhX3

One year ago today, we pledged to end the war in Yemen. We cannot forget our commitment to ending this humanitarian crisis and relieving the suffering of the Yemeni people. We need to act. 

https://t.co/X8A9NacAho

Abandoned oil and gas wells leak methane gas, which drives climate change. I'm glad to see @POTUS taking steps to stem methane gas emissions and ensure a greener, safer future for all Americans. https://t.co/9fkSQIxyyK

Our postal system is failing rural Vermonters, making it harder for folks to get their prescriptions and pay their bills. We need to pass the Postal Service Reform Act so Vermonters can once again get a reliable USPS. https://t.co/zq08EKYhsa

I’m proud to join @LetsGrowKids in calling for more support for childcare 

We need to pass legislation to ensure better pay and conditions for providers and more support for families to meet the cost of childcare. https://t.co/wFcieGS2Zf

Exposure to forever chemicals can cause serious health conditions, but more than 200 million Americans have forever chemicals in their drinking water. Our communities deserve better. 

I’m calling on @POTUS to include funding to reduce PFAS contamination in his budget request. https://t.co/kOkmnMXSCA

Today we celebrate the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth, a time to honor the history of Black Americans and continue the fight for racial equity in Vermont & across the country. For those looking to celebrate during the month, @bfp_news has a helpful guide.
https://t.co/9yvZ1GFd5s

It’s time for our government to step up and protect Americans from Big Pharma’s abusive pricing. 

I’ve joined @RepSusanWild in calling for immediate action to lower drug prices. https://t.co/yuYouE1mEG

No family should struggle to #KeepTheHeatOn when winter sets in. 

On #NationalEnergyAssistanceDay, we highlight the Low-Income Heating and Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP), which provides much-needed support for home heating costs for those in need. https://t.co/h4Mjh2DSpg

Supply chain issues have impacted all of us, but their effects have been particularly dire for US agriculture. I joined my colleagues in a letter to @POTUS, urging the administration to take action to address the supply chain crisis and mitigate risk to Vermont's farmers. https://t.co/6wSG0SC1qg

Too many Vermonters can't access online learning or telehealth because of the cost of internet service. I voted for the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which includes new aid for families struggling to pay for their internet. Visit https://t.co/Cu4tumOScX to see if you qualify.

I joined this letter. 89% of borrowers with full-time jobs expect to be financially insecure if the pause on student loan payments ends. That puts millions of Americans and their families at risk. It's time for permanent relief, and that starts with seeing DOE's memo to @POTUS. https://t.co/AWqOGoyfLD

The IRS has a massive backlog without enough staff or resources to work through it. Many Vermonters can't get their tax returns and or answers to basic questions. @SenSanders, @SenatorLeahy, and I wrote to the IRS for answers because Vermonters deserve better. https://t.co/BD4smnbDNX

The #CleanAirAct protects families from air pollution and helps combat the climate crisis. Republican-led states and polluters are fighting in the Supreme Court to undermine it. I stand with my colleagues to support this essential environmental protection.https://t.co/KYlV0yMjP0

The USPS is under-resourced and mismanaged, and it's made vital services unreliable, particularly in rural areas. That's unacceptable. I'll keep fighting for the USPS service Vermonters need and deserve. https://t.co/mdFqy7ZMy3

Congratulations to these Olympics-bound Vermont athletes! There's a lot of talent in the Green Mountain State, and we are so excited to watch these Vermonters show their skills to the world.
https://t.co/mz48H35Euj

Energy-efficient housing saves families money + protects our planet. There's great work happening in Vermont to make mobile homes more efficient, but we must update long-ignored energy efficiency standards to make efficient housing accessible to everyone. https://t.co/bqQXpOyOsI

This Saturday marks the 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade. Today, many states are working to ban abortion outright. It's unacceptable. Abortion is health care and access shouldn't depend on where you live. I'll keep fighting for abortion rights in America. https://t.co/V392MmPILz

This week, the Senate voted on legislation to protect early voting, end gerrymandering, and create automatic voter registration. All Republicans voted NO. Under the filibuster, the minority rules in the Senate. It's time to overturn the filibuster and protect our democracy.

Health care workers have served our communities so well during this pandemic. But the last two years have been hard, and health care workers need our support. HHS has pledged $103 million to support mental health among health care workers. For more, visit: https://t.co/q5dAwnIE1B

Proud to join the Elmore community in supporting their rural post office. Postal service is essential to community wellbeing, but the USPS faces serious challenges. We must invest in the USPS and strengthen its rural operations to ensure Vermonters get the service they need. https://t.co/RhfWsI28fe
Together with COVID-19 vaccines, home COVID tests can help us control the virus's spread. You can order free home COVID tests here: https://t.co/cEWTbsoTAt

New infrastructure funding is much-needed here in Vermont. These projects make our lives safer, our economies stronger, and our communities more connected. This bill is good for Vermonters, and I'm excited to see these funds arrive in our state. https://t.co/a0tKzjKREk

When I was a young man, I had the honor of hearing Dr. King speak in person. He spoke of love, hope, and commitment to ending racism. His words stirred me and they sustain me today. Let us honor his memory and vision and continue the fight for equality and voting rights for all. https://t.co/AxozLdNsGV

As we navigate the Omicron surge, it's more important than ever to have accessible and affordable health insurance. Visit https://t.co/aTSwCZptyt to get your coverage before the deadline ends TOMORROW, Jan. 15th.

Under the American Rescue Plan, families received monthly Child Tax Credit payments, helping folks pay for groceries, bills, and school supplies. That program has expired but we won’t stop fighting for families to receive those payments again by passing the Build Back Better Act. https://t.co/b2yyIahRIe

Climate change increases the frequency of extreme weather conditions and puts our homes and businesses at risk of serious flooding. We need to act now and reduce greenhouse gas emissions to protect our communities from catastrophic damage. https://t.co/8GgvZQKTDH
There's more work to be done to give all Americans the tools we need to stay safe during this pandemic, but this is a great development. Let's keep up the fight. https://t.co/zhw1MiOwaL

This morning, the House voted on voting rights legislation that requires states to allow early voting, establishes automatic voter registration, and creates other essential protections for voters. I voted YES to protect our democracy and your right to vote.

This pandemic isn't over. Vaccines provide real protection from severe infection, but Vermonters need more help to stay safe. I've joined @RepRoKhanna, @RepAdamSchiff, and @SenSanders to call for expanded access to rapid tests for all Americans. For more: https://t.co/0FsaE739Km https://t.co/sHEBqz9K6l

Happy National Milk Day! Let's celebrate the proud history of Vermont dairy farms like Stowe's Keewaydin Farm, which marks 100 years in 2022. 
https://t.co/iEElMiPX2A

I stand with @POTUS here. Our democracy is at stake. We must advance voting rights legislation and protect access to the ballot box for all Americans. To get there, the filibuster has to go so we can end minority rule in the US Senate. https://t.co/Y2Xz5fYJ1m

They may not be glamorous, but energy efficiency standards dramatically reduce greenhouse gas emissions, protect our planet, and save consumers money. By updating our EE standards, @ENERGY can make huge strides in the fight against climate change.
https://t.co/cEWkv54C2T

1 in 3 families struggles to pay their home heating bills. We've got a responsibility to keep our communities safe and healthy and help these families meet their energy costs. With this new LIHEAP funding, more Vermont families will stay warm this winter.
https://t.co/nzOE5bxoLn

The federal No Surprises Act protects patients from surprise medical bills, a huge step forward for healthcare accessibility and affordability. Let's keep up the fight to make healthcare affordable and accessible for all Americans.  https://t.co/ARW8CgI1Pz

We have a responsibility to our children and to the global community to do all we can to protect our climate. This is a moment for action. We must pass #BuildBackBetter and ensure a safe climate for generations to come. https://t.co/6q6JeSRen1

No one should have to choose between paying for groceries and keeping the heat on. LIHEAP helps low-income, elderly, and disabled folks pay their energy bills. With new federal funds, more Vermonters than ever can benefit from the program. For more, visit: https://t.co/rnR7FYZFiG

Since January 6, legislatures across the country have passed laws undermining our democracy, making it harder to vote, and handing over power to partisan legislatures. These policies are anti-democratic and suppress Americans’ rights. They must be stopped. https://t.co/km6Q7NhuMx

Make no mistake the events of January 6th, 2021 were an attack on our democracy. The attack continues in states across the country. Together we can beat them back and strengthen our democracy by advancing voting rights and protecting our electoral system. https://t.co/UzJutEp9Si

One year ago today, I stood in the House chamber as a violent mob attempted to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election. It was harrowing. What’s clear from that day is that we need to do all we can to protect and strengthen our democracy. https://t.co/igABinwQ3N

Democracy survived the horrific events of January 6th, but it is imperiled. We need to do all that we can to preserve, protect, and defend the right to vote and the integrity of our electoral system. https://t.co/CK70rOoc48

More than 50% of Americans say they've received an unexpectedly large medical bill. This year, the No Surprises Act takes effect protecting patients against surprise medical bills and helping them get the care they need without breaking the bank. For more: https://t.co/Cj4Kj0XAXy https://t.co/Wc8SRTGzEN

Addiction treatment through telemedicine is a huge help to our rural communities battling substance use disorder. I urge the DEA to continue to allow patients to receive life-saving medication-assisted treatment through telemedicine. 
https://t.co/AS2LH8wZLR

New Year’s Resolutions? I’ve got a few. 
🔘Pass #BuildBackBetter for universal childcare, drug pricing reform, and a safe climate.
🔘Protect our democracy and expand voting rights.
🔘Safeguard labor and abortion rights and pass the #PROAct and the #WomensHealthProtectionAct.

This is what makes #BuildBackBetter so important. We need to reform our tax code to support working families, not billionaires. It's a challenging road ahead, but I’ll keep fighting for a fairer system for all Americans. https://t.co/fckkUtkzwZ

So many Vermonters lack access to high-speed broadband. Through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we can start to close the digital divide and get Vermonters connected with the broadband service they need to thrive. https://t.co/TMNc0ng4qG

My thoughts are with Senator Reid’s family today. I admired Harry for his quiet but determined leadership and his commitment to fight for the voiceless. Let’s carry on his legacy of standing up for the most vulnerable among us in the year ahead. https://t.co/lcwN916NPu

I hope that all those celebrating have a peaceful and joyous holiday. Today, I'll be taking the time to reflect on the creativity and resilience of my fellow Vermonters and listening to a little Grace Potter to mark the day. https://t.co/FH8Ig89Nhv
Happy holidays! Wishing you a safe, healthy, and happy holiday season. https://t.co/rKTi4A6DsY

For those planning to gather safely over the holiday, testing is key. Vermont is distributing 60,000 take-home rapid tests between Dec 23rd and Dec 30th. To find a distribution site, visit: https://t.co/LoK0OPaBSb

Winter in Vermont is a special time, but it can also be challenging. This article showcases some great ways to embrace the winter. Whether you love to ski or prefer to watch the snow from inside, there are so many ways to enjoy Vermont's beautiful winters. https://t.co/WoJSH5F5ur

Biogen’s price gouging sent Medicare premiums sky-high. Now they've slashed prices by 50% to drive up sales, showing just how arbitrary drug prices are. Big Pharma will do anything to boost profits. We need to protect patients from this abusive pricing. https://t.co/rSvRQAPFgM

I'm always amazed by the creativity of Vermonters. @ShikiWrap is one of many Vermont businesses using that creativity to help the environment and make this holiday season a little greener for all Vermonters. https://t.co/VHrc39UC9H
This story is everything we love about our home state. Congratulations on your retirement, Rita! And thank you for your years of dedicated service. https://t.co/epPRcJyEmc

.@VPR has great ideas on how to bring Vermont's natural beauty into our homes for a bit of holiday joy. Harvesting from our surroundings for holiday decorations is a great way to appreciate Vermont's beauty and get outside during the colder months.
 https://t.co/7OVdYahwny

This is good news: patients can now access abortion pills through the mail, instead of having to visit an in-person provider. Though there's much more work to be done, this is a positive step in the fight for abortion access.
https://t.co/ef808hQpgd

Electric vehicles are key to a sustainable future, but they're unaffordable for most. Today, I led a group of 19 of my colleagues in a letter to carmakers on the need for affordable EVs to combat the climate crisis and improve air quality. For more, visit: https://t.co/drk3rRBj4A https://t.co/FgrWEU4S63

I toured Goodrich Family Farm today and visited their anaerobic digester, which is the largest in the northeast. This digester turns food scraps and manure into natural gas, reducing greenhouse gas emissions from food and animal waste and providing a local energy source. https://t.co/JXfModdMjn

I joined @AgeWellVT for a @_MealsOnWheels delivery this morning and learned about the great work they do in our communities. Food aid and personal connection are critical for seniors as we enter the cold winter months and Age Well provides both for the most vulnerable among us. https://t.co/e1k4GSGfSd

Today's child tax credit payment will be the last expanded payment families receive unless the Senate passes #BuildBackBetter. CTC is critical: October payments kept 3.6 million kids out of poverty. We need to pass BBB and preserve the Child Tax Credit. 
https://t.co/egbL3fbFS7

The enrollment period for Dairy Margin Coverage is open now and runs through February 18. Farmers looking to enroll, update production numbers, or determine whether risk management coverage through DMC is right for you, please visit: 
https://t.co/g42jvSn3c1

Danone's offer to Vermont farmers is a good first step. But it doesn't match the scale of the damage they've done by leaving Vermont's dairy farmers in the lurch. My statement here: https://t.co/FMCa7eCPPi https://t.co/t2smrCfAGz

This number is staggering: 1 in 100 older Americans has died from COVID-19. Vaccination remains our best tool in the fight against this pandemic, and I urge all Vermonters to get vaccinated and boosted to protect our communities. https://t.co/aurkwDGsMM

When times are tough, one thing is certain: Vermonters help each other. Dan & Whit's is part of my daily routine at home in Norwich, and it's been so inspiring to see folks come together to help this cornerstone of our community.
https://t.co/dNvUl9CJ52

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help Vermont do some amazing things. From repairing our roads to cleaning our water and electrifying our transportation, these new projects will make Vermont communities safer, healthier, and greener. https://t.co/FmBuMyPh8E

The good news is that Dems have a plan. Passing #BuildBackBetter will lower drug prices and protect patients from these outrageous price hikes. This report's conclusions are frustrating -- but we can and must act here. Let's pass #BuildBackBetter and end Pharma's abuses. 2/2

.@OversightDems just released their report on drug pricing, and here's the bottom line: Big Pharma uses unfair and unjustified price increases to increase their revenues. They put your health in jeopardy to line their pockets. It's wrong, and we've got to put a stop to it. 1/2

I voted yesterday to pass the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act. This bill prevents presidential abuses of power, roots out corruption, and strengthens our elections system. Democracy is under threat from authoritarianism and election interference, and this bill is a critical defense.

I'm fighting to increase support for folks with substance use disorders. With funding from the American Rescue Plan, @SAMHSA has launched a $30 million Harm Reduction Grant Program to support community-based harm reduction. This program will save lives. https://t.co/lI16fDcJ1G

The federal government is our nation's largest energy consumer and should pave the way for a greener future. I applaud @POTUS for this landmark order and for leading by example. https://t.co/clxK4UUyjA

VT businesses are driving the clean energy movement. With support from @USDA, Eden Sand & Gravel will build a new solar array to power 82 homes and expand clean energy in the Green Mountain State. That's good for business and it's good for the planet. https://t.co/7r8pgqZ6w1

I joined @RepJayapal and @RepCori in the call to protect and expand insulin price caps in the #BuildBackBetter Act. This is our chance to make insulin affordable for every American. Let's seize this moment and make insulin access a right, not a luxury. https://t.co/68ErRc8ZPk https://t.co/RdJDlur3mv

Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, health coverage through the Marketplace is more affordable than ever before. The deadline to sign up for coverage beginning January 1st is one week from today. Sign up, get covered, and get the care you need. https://t.co/BkAYgrK9pO

It's exciting to see more Vermonters producing maple syrup and appreciating our beloved maple trees. But climate change puts this Vermont tradition in jeopardy. To protect the sugaring season for future generations, we must act on climate change now. https://t.co/D0QvGwdZA3

This is major: new analysis from @AmProg shows that #BuildBackBetter increases the number of Vermont kids receiving childcare subsidies by 14x. That's more than 20,000 Vermont kids and their families getting the help they need to pay for childcare. https://t.co/R1wpMa6CdG

The Senate just voted to confirm @JRosenworcel to serve as FCC chair. Jessica is terrific! And a champion for broadband access and a fantastic partner in efforts to build a connected and equitable future. Congratulations, Chairwoman! Excited to work together.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law includes long-overdue investments in our water infrastructure that will expand access to clean water across Vermont. There's more work to be done, but this funding will be crucial for the Green Mountain State. 
https://t.co/XtKWF1uoBm

I completely agree with @POTUS here -- there's real unity across parties on cutting drug costs for Americans. The House has taken action by passing #BuildBackBetter. Now it's the Senate's turn to move the ball forward and get this done for Americans. https://t.co/ALeWu7nWWa

It's a scandal that so many Americans may soon lose abortion access. The House took action and passed the Women's Health Protection Act, which ensures the right to abortion at the federal level. The Senate must do the same. Because #AbortionIsEssential. https://t.co/Fhv9ty5Z2F

9,000 Vermont kids gain access to free school meals through the #BuildBackBetter Act. We've got a major opportunity here: with Build Back Better, we can feed more Vermont kids and set them up for the healthy futures they deserve.
Many Americans find themselves in the grip of substance use disorder. To help these folks, we need treatment more than we need prosecution. https://t.co/udsOmFzyse

Exciting news @DOE: $13M investment in federal energy efficiency, clean energy, and climate resilience. This funding leverages private investment, for a total of $737M. A huge step forward in greening the nation's largest energy consumer. https://t.co/MPLi4DbfgN

Unregulated Big Tech represents a threat to our democracy and to the safety and wellbeing of our kids. I'm proposing a new federal agency to regulate the far reaching activities of the Big Tech industry and protect our democracy. https://t.co/auJnjkVFD9

I'd like to extend a warm welcome to our returning National Guard troops. You've made Vermonters proud, and we're so glad to have you home in time for the holidays. 
https://t.co/TClFI2Da04
Proud to stand up for abortion rights with @ProChoiceCaucus this morning. Abortion is essential health care and it must be protected. https://t.co/Ll6M4tpg6D

Do you want to give back to Vermont and learn more about Congress? Come join my team. The deadline to apply for our paid Spring internships in Vermont and DC is this Friday, December 3rd. 
https://t.co/r6Vco1cFT6

The constitutional right to abortion helps folks shape their futures and lets families decide how and when they grow. For a safer and more equal future, #AbortionIsEssential. We must protect the right to safe and accessible abortion.

I’m looking forward to hearing from @FrancesHaugen about Section 230 reform and holding Big Tech accountable. But we need to go beyond Section 230. That’s why I’m working on a bill to create a new agency to regulate the tech industry. https://t.co/EmYllFDcX1
We have to start prioritizing the needs of patients, not pharmaceutical companies. That starts with #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/yWNVgJ0Tsn

As we learn more about the new variant, I urge Vermonters to get vaccinated and boosted to ensure the best protection against COVID-19. We don't know much about Omicron yet, but we know vaccination is our best defense against severe illness. Get the shot and protect one another. https://t.co/CMtUaQwYk1

Congratulations to @VTWomensFund on the launch of their new tool for identifying women-owned businesses and business leaders in your community. You can check it out here and support women’s business ownership this holiday season. https://t.co/FDf7t7xTdT.
Times have been tough, but we’re grateful that we can gather safely with friends and family today and enjoy a wonderful meal. Happy thanksgiving! https://t.co/M8st8WRf8t
There is so much more work to do and we all must commit to do the work, every day.

Holding Ahmaud Arbery’s family in my thoughts today. My hope is that his loved ones receive some comfort in this verdict, but it won’t bring him back. These men were held accountable for his murder only because people stood up to a system that took 74 days to make an arrest.

I’m always grateful for Vermont’s native wildlife species, and I’m sure we’ve all got turkeys on the brain this week. Thanks to @Banner_News for the fun facts about one of our state's best-known birds! https://t.co/CzbfkpttuP
The wealthy use loopholes and gaps in our tax code to protect themselves from paying their fair share of taxes. #BuildBackBetter puts a stop to that. https://t.co/Mgh4Hl8XyY

The Restaurant Revitalization Fund has helped many vital community businesses stay afloat during the pandemic, but more needs to be done. I'm calling on @POTUS to support replenishing the fund and giving local businesses the chance to thrive. https://t.co/vTN3wWjfL4

You may have heard about the Methane Emissions Reduction Program in #BuildBackBetter. This program will reduce methane emissions from the oil-and-gas industry, building a safer climate for everyone. For more, visit: https://t.co/ERadFOZg7w https://t.co/zgSv4WUCbl

From our power grid to the crops we grow to our Thanksgiving tables, no area of American life will be spared from climate change. That’s why it’s critical that we pass #BuildBackBetter and reduce greenhouse gas emissions that drive climate change. https://t.co/9Y3d4QgkbD

With Build Back Better, we'll get to implement my HOMES program, a national version of California's proposal. This program benefits consumers, creates good local jobs, and reduces carbon emissions. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/8SaddtpEcp

I want to extend a warm welcome to our new neighbors, Afghan refugees who have begun arriving in Vermont this week. Welcome to the Green Mountain State, we're glad you're here! https://t.co/0z1bnMa5g1

Two of my biggest priorities in Congress have been fighting to lower healthcare costs for every Vermonter and addressing climate change. In passing #BuildBackBetter, House Democrats just took a huge step forward on both fronts. More work to do! Onwards.
It’s time for a more just tax code. With #BuildBackBetter, the ultra-rich will finally pay their fair share of taxes. https://t.co/trygq5HEVg
What’s in #BuildBackBetter? Landmark investments in childcare, health care, and combatting climate change. To learn more, visit: https://t.co/9aSoyPrigu https://t.co/gM4yDT8d4R
@billmckibben Thank you for your leadership, Bill. On to the next step!
